autograd.torch.nn package

Submodules

autograd.torch.nn.functional module

Functional interface

autograd.torch.nn.functional.binary_cross_entropy(input, target)

Computes the binary cross entropy loss between input and target tensors.

Args:

input: The input tensor. target: The target tensor.

Returns:

The binary cross entropy loss.

autograd.torch.nn.functional.exp(input)

Computes the element-wise exponential of the input tensor.

Args:

input: The input tensor.

Returns:

The tensor with exponential values.

autograd.torch.nn.functional.huber_loss(input, target, delta=1.0)

Computes the Huber loss between input and target tensors.

Args:

input: The input tensor. target: The target tensor. delta: The threshold for the absolute error.

Returns:

The Huber loss.

autograd.torch.nn.functional.log(input)

Computes the element-wise natural logarithm of the input tensor.

Args:

input: The input tensor.

Returns:

The tensor with logarithmic values.

autograd.torch.nn.functional.log_softmax(input, dim=-1)

Computes the logarithm of softmax activations along a specified dimension of the input tensor.

Args:

input: The input tensor. dim: The dimension along which to compute the softmax.

Returns:

The tensor with log softmax values.

autograd.torch.nn.functional.mse_loss(input, target)

Computes the mean squared error (MSE) loss between input and target tensors.

Args:

input: The input tensor. target: The target tensor.

Returns:

The mean squared error loss.

autograd.torch.nn.functional.nll_loss(input, target)

Computes the negative log likelihood loss between input and target tensors.

Args:

input: The input tensor. target: The target tensor.

Returns:

The negative log likelihood loss.

autograd.torch.nn.functional.relu(input)

Computes the element-wise rectified linear activation (ReLU) of the input tensor.

Args:

input: The input tensor.

Returns:

The tensor with ReLU-applied values.

autograd.torch.nn.functional.sigmoid(input)

Computes the element-wise sigmoid activation of the input tensor.

Args:

input: The input tensor.

Returns:

The tensor with sigmoid-applied values.

autograd.torch.nn.functional.tanh(input)

Computes the element-wise hyperbolic tangent of the input tensor.

Args:

input: The input tensor.

Returns:

The tensor with hyperbolic tangent values.

autograd.torch.nn.module module

class autograd.torch.nn.module.Linear(in_features, out_features, name='')

Bases: Module

Linear layer applies a linear transformation to the input: y = x W.T + b.

forward(inp)

Performs a forward pass through the Linear layer.

Args:

inp: The input tensor.

Returns:

The result of the forward pass.

class autograd.torch.nn.module.Module

Bases: object

Base class for neural network modules.

forward(*args, **kwargs)

Performs the forward pass through the module.

This method needs to be implemented by subclasses to define the actual computation that takes place during the forward pass.

Raises:

NotImplementedError: If the forward method is not implemented in a subclass.

modules()

Returns an iterator over all sub-modules.

Returns:

An iterator over the sub-modules.

parameters()

Returns an iterator over all parameters in the module and its sub-modules.

Returns:

An iterator over the parameters.
